alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Grady (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 19 at 2:26AM CDT until May 19 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN KINGFISHER...NORTHERN GRADY...CENTRAL CADDO... SOUTHEASTERN BLAINE AND CANADIAN COUNTIES... At 224 AM CDT, the leading edge of winds from severe thunderstorms was located along a line extending from 4 miles southeast of Dover to 3 miles north of Concho to 6 miles northwest of Cogar to 3 miles northeast of Fort Cobb, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...A mesonet weather station located 7 miles west of Hinton recorded a 68 mph wind gust at 205 AM. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Western Oklahoma City, El Reno, Chickasha, Anadarko, Kingfisher, Yukon, Mustang, Tuttle, Piedmont, Hinton, Union City, Minco, Geary, Okarche, Cashion, Binger, Fort Cobb, Verden, Calumet and Dover. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
